definition: to retire (from society, esp. from politics)/to vanish
secret/hidden/concealed/(prefix) crypto-
to lean upon
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw

sentences.english: Mr Ackermann is stepping down as the German bank's chief executive.
sentences.chinese: 作爲德意志銀行的首席執行官，阿爾克曼將逐漸隱退。

sentences.english: When the dynasty gradually retreated, its elegant demeanour is still highly esteemed and praised by people in the world.
sentences.chinese: 當王朝漸漸隱退，華庭風采卻依舊爲世人所推崇。

sentences.english: After his retirement from the official circle, where did Fan Li go?
sentences.chinese: 范蠡隱退官場之後到哪裏去了呢？

sentences.english: For a couple of years, I retreated into a life of bohemian bachelorhood.
sentences.chinese: 幾年來，我都過着一種隱退的波西米亞式的獨身生活。

definition: to take refuge in religious life
to vanish without trace (idiom)/to lie low
to stake all on one throw
talented and good-looking (idiom)
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
magnificent style unmatched in his generation (idiom); peerless talent
to travel around the country
extermination of an entire family (ancient Chinese punishment)
to die/euphemism, lit. to return West or to the Western Paradise
to be reluctant to give up a post
venturing from one's thatched hut for the first time (idiom)/young and inexperienced/novice/greenhorn
to change (appearance)/to change shape
not to engage in honest work/to ignore one's proper occupation/not to attend to one's proper duties
deep in debt
see 婚外情[hun1 wai4 qing2]
rumors and slanders (idiom); gossip/lies and slanders
